title: Robotics
summary: Robotics is a branch of engineering and computer science involving the design, construction, operation, and application of robotsâ€”machines programmed to execute complex tasks automatically, often substituting for human effort in repetitive, dangerous, or precision-demanding activities. The field's modern origins trace to the mid-20th century, with the Unimate, the first industrially deployed robot arm, installed at a General Motors plant in 1961 to handle die-casting tasks, marking the start of automated manufacturing on a large scale.
